meanings.definition: Inspiring fear or unease; strange and frightening.
meanings.sent1: The dark forest had an eerie atmosphere that made me shiver.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house looked eerie in the moonlight.
meanings.sent3: The eerie sound of a cat meowing in the middle of the night startled me.
meanings.sent4: Her eerie smile sent chills down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the graveyard was unsettling.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of an eerie feeling; weird.
meanings.sent1: The eerie painting seemed to follow me with its eyes.
meanings.sent2: The old doll had an eerie expression on its face.
meanings.sent3: It was eerie how the clock seemed to be ticking backward.
meanings.sent4: The eerie glow of the fireflies lit up the night.
meanings.sent5: The eerie fog made everything look mysterious.
